body_text: #510 doesn't use any .sjs files, but you should  be able to, according to the httpd docs. You might have to add server.registerContentType("sjs", "sjs");, but I wouldn't be surprised if that were the default.
body: #510 doesn't use any `.sjs` files, but you should  be able to, according to [the httpd docs](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/httpd.js/HTTP_server_for_unit_tests#SJS:_server-side_scripts). You might have to add `server.registerContentType("sjs", "sjs");`, but I wouldn't be surprised if that were the default.
body_html: #510 doesn't use any .sjs files, but you should be able to, according to the httpd docs. You might have to add server.registerContentType("sjs", "sjs");, but I wouldn't be surprised if that were the default.
